00007 #include <stdio.h>
00008 #include <string.h>
00009 #include <vector>
00010 #include <fstream>
00011 #include "CSoundSlot.h"
00012 #include "../../CLogFile.h"
00013 #include "../../fileio.h"
00014 #include "../../fileio/ResourceMgmt.h"
00015 #include "../../FindFile.h"
00016 
00017 CSoundSlot::CSoundSlot() {
00018  m_sounddata = NULL;
00019  m_soundlength = 0;
00020 }
00021 
00022 // loads sound searchname from file fname, into sounds[] entry loadnum
00023 // return value is false on failure
00024 bool CSoundSlot::loadSound(const std::string& fname, const std::string& path, const std::string& searchname, unsigned int loadnum)
00025 {
00026  // Unload the sound if any was previously loaded
00027  if(m_sounddata){ delete[] m_sounddata; m_sounddata = NULL; }
00028  
00029  // If a high quality sound file is available, try to open it.
00030  // Otherwise open the classic sounds from the original data files
00031  if(HQSndDrv_Load(m_pAudioSpec, &m_hqsound, m_gamepath, searchname) == 0)
00032  {
00033   return true;
00034  }
00035  else
00036  {
00037   int curheader = 0x10;
00038   int offset, priority, garbage, nr_of_sounds;
00039   char name[12];
00040   
00041   memset(name,0,12);
00042   
00043   FILE *fp;
00044   if (! (fp = OpenGameFile(getResourceFilename(fname, path, true, true), "rb")) )
00045   {
00046    g_pLogFile->ftextOut("loadSound : Sounds file '%s' unopenable attempting load of '%s'<br>", fname.c_str(), searchname.c_str());
00047    return false;
00048   }
00049   
00050   fseek(fp, 0x6, SEEK_SET);
00051   nr_of_sounds = fgeti(fp);
00052   
00053   for(int j=0; j<nr_of_sounds || feof(fp) ; j++)
00054   {
00055    fseek(fp, curheader, SEEK_SET);
00056    offset = fgeti(fp);
00057    priority = fgetc(fp);
00058    garbage = fgetc(fp);
00059    
00060    for(int i=0;i<12;i++) name[i] = fgetc(fp);
00061    if (name == searchname)
00062    {
00063     fseek(fp, offset, SEEK_SET);
00064     
00065     signed int sample;
00066     // Read the file and convert it into waveform
00067     std::vector<unsigned int> waveform;
00068     do
00069     {
00070      sample = fgeti(fp);
00071      waveform.push_back( (sample != 0x0000 && sample != 0xFFFF) ? (0x1234DD/sample) : sample );
00072     }while (sample != 0xffff);
00073     
00074     m_soundlength = waveform.size();
00075     
00076     // copy the data to the real m_sounddata block and reduce fragmentation!
00077     m_sounddata = new unsigned int[m_soundlength];
00078     
00079     memcpy(m_sounddata, &waveform[0], waveform.size()*sizeof(unsigned int));
00080     
00081     g_pLogFile->ftextOut("loadSound : loaded sound %s of %d bytes.<br>", searchname.c_str(), m_soundlength);
00082     m_hqsound.enabled = false;
00083     
00084     fclose(fp);
00085     return true;
00086    }
00087    
00088    curheader += 0x10;
00089   }
00090   // sound could not be found
00091   g_pLogFile->ftextOut("loadSound : sound %s could not be found in %s.<br>", searchname.c_str(), fname.c_str());
00092   fclose(fp);
00093   return false;
00094  }
00095 }
00096 
00097 CSoundSlot::~CSoundSlot() {
00098  HQSndDrv_Unload(&m_hqsound);
00099  if(m_sounddata){ delete[] m_sounddata; m_sounddata = NULL; }
00100  m_hqsound.enabled = false;
00101 }
